alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A few strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern New Castle, Montgomery, Chester, northern Philadelphia and central Delaware Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a few thunderstorms near Marshallton, or 7 miles west of West Chester, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, West Chester, Norristown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Souderton, Ambler, Kennett Square, Collegeville, Oxford, Royersford, Jenkintown and Narberth. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 310 and 345. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 34. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 340. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
